scenario_text.value:
I don’t know... I don’t know anything! What
in the world am I supposed to do?!
Hey, calm down, Shuuji.

Calm down? How am I supposed to CALM DOWN?!
We don’t know anything. We’re just guessing!

Even considering the stuff Jijimon told us...
It was nothing but hearsay and fairy tales!
So what the heck do you suggest we do?!
Hey, back off... I’m only saying the truth!

We’re doing everything we can to get back
home, you know! All of us!

But all you’re doing is spreading doubt.
What’s your deal, man?

You gonna run around like a headless chicken?
And then just lie down and die here?!
I...I never intended to—!

Then enough with the yap yap! Keep your
gutless whining to yourself! Got it?!
Nnngh...

All right, all right, enough, guys. This is
no time for us to be fighting.

He’s right. Our only choice now is to believe
what Jijimon told us.

We can’t act without some sort of direction,
now can we? Will the two of you get on board?

No worries, I’ll play along. Can’t speak for
this guy, though.

...It isn’t like I’m trying to cause problems
or anything.

We know that there were kids in this world
besides us, right?

If we find out what became of them, we may
discover a way to go home.

Yeah, that makes sense. Sounds like a good
place to start.
Nnngh...

Even so... That means we’ll have to put the
screws to those guys, right?

I get the feeling they won’t tell us with
a simple “pretty please, with sugar on top.”

All we know is that offering a sacrifice to
a god or whatever causes something to happen.

It’s happened several times in the past,
apparently.

When that fog clears up, it gets easier to
move around.
Should we ask Jijimon for more details?

I can’t wrap my head around the whole thing,
but...sacrificing human kids is wrong!

Yeah, Jijimon thinks so too, from the sound
of it. And you know I feel the same.

Yeah! We won’t let that happen! I dunno what
I’d do if Takuma got sacrificed!

We’ll all go back together. No one needs to
be sacrificed.

That’s the best case scenario for sure.
Even you can understand that, right Shuuji?
(I wonder what the others think?)
I’ll ask Minoru.
I’ll ask Miu.
I’ll ask Saki.
What about you two?

Nobody should be served up as a sacrifice,
of course!

I feel the same. I have no desire to allow
Minoru to be “served up,” as it were.

Minoru may lack maturity, but the boy is
brimming with potential.

I cannot allow such potential to be cut short
at such an early juncture.

Aww jeez, Falcomon, you’re making me blush
over here!
What do you two think?

“Sacrifice” this, “sacrifice” that... Gets
me a little curious, y’know?
I don’t want Miu to be a sacrifice!

I’m just kidding! No way I wanna end up some
kinda offering.
Yeah, no way! I mean it!

I’m happy to hear you say that, Syakomon.
Miu isn’t the easiest kid to get along with.

Say what?! Show me one way I’m not easy!
Out with it!
That’s not true! Miu’s a super good kid!

HA! You hear that, Taku-meanie?! You could
learn a thing or two from Syakomon here!

(Is it just me...or is she looking a little
shy after Syakomon praised her?)

Yeah, you’re right. Guess I’m still riding
that first impression. I’ll be more careful.
You better be!
You tell ’im, Syakomon!
(Those two seem okay...)
What do you two think?

I’m against sacrifices and all that, but
I admit I’m curious...
Curious? About what?

Is there a way to solve things without
a sacrifice? And if so, who would know?

In the end, we have to go to the enemy’s base
to find out, right? Just like Kaito said.

I get the logic, but that means we’ll have to
fight. That’s the part that scares me...
Saki...

(She’s right. Logic isn’t everything,
especially when it comes to our situation.)
Um... Er...
Shut up! Don’t say anything!

Shuuji, you know Lopmon’s trying for your
sake, don’t you?

Well isn’t that nice! Must be great for you
guys to just trust each other like that.

But have you considered what other people
must feel like?!

We don’t even know what the heck these
creatures are, you know!

Without knowing that, how could I possibly
trust them and work with them?!

You got any better ideas?! We got no choice
but to trust these guys!

Trust these...these weird THINGS?!
Please... That’s too stupid for me, sorry!
What an awful thing to say...

We don’t know what we are... But Takuma is
the one who’ll teach me!
Agumon...

I trust Takuma! When I’m with him, I learn
all sorts of things!
We don’t really know anything, but still...

These little guys believe in us. That means
we gotta trust them too, right?

And besides, I doubt most of those creatures
are even after us.

Some are neutral like Jijimon, and even
among the ones that have attacked us,

not everyone was allied with those guys.
I bet we can trust most of them!
Not a very convincing argument...

And besides, the fact that some ARE after us
hasn’t changed!

You want to fight them without any idea
what’s going on? I don’t think so! Get real!

(I understand where Shuuji’s coming from, but
we won’t get anywhere thinking like this.)

(We have no choice but to trust Agumon and
the others to get through this.)

(Still...easier said than done. What exactly
can we do to weather this storm?)
(What’s our best course of action?)
Act with caution.
Trust our partners.
Maybe get more allies?

I get what you’re saying, Shuuji. It’s too
risky to make reckless moves.

So then when exactly should we take action?
When are we gonna be able to go home?

You think I’m gonna waste my life waiting
around and leaving things to chance?!

We don’t have a choice but to trust Agumon
and the rest of them. It’s our only option.
I feel the same way...

But are you sure no other methods are
available to us?

Even if we take this dangerous path, we must
always be aware of our own safety.

Some of these creatures are neutral, like
Minoru said. What if we got them to join us?

If they are like the ones at the amusement
park, they would not be much use in a fight.

What’s more, more allies means more people to
lead. We must remain unified in purpose.

Still, we have more questions than answers
here. The legends... That fog...

We won’t learn anything unless we do
something, right? So we’ve gotta try.
Don’t think you can just ignore me!

I mean, all you’re saying is we should do
nothing, so...
Dammit...dammit! Why do you guys...
What to do? Whose opinion should I listen to?
What does Kaito think?
I should hear Miu out.
Agumon wants to say something.

You sound like you’d rather do something and
see what happens, am I right, Kaito?

What other choice do we got? I don’t plan on
waiting around here to be sacrificed.

Me neither. But Shuuji’s right about one
thing: We don’t have a lot of allies here...

Yeah, but we can’t exactly make more by
sitting on our hands, now can we?

True. So I kinda wish we could take a second
to chill and think about our next step...
What do you think, Miu?

I... I don’t know. I have no idea what we
should do.
I see. Sorry to put on you the spot.

(Miu’s just a kid, after all... The rest of
us have to pull our weight.)

What’s wrong, Takuma? You don’t look too
happy.

I honestly don’t know what to do... What do
you think, Agumon?

I believe in you, Takuma! Whatever answer you
come up with, I’m sure it’ll be the best one!
Heh... Thanks, pal.

(If Agumon has that much faith in me, I’d
better hold it together.)
What do you think we should do, Ryo?
I’m stumped. What about you?

Well... If possible, I’d like all of us to
work towards a common goal.
Sounds easy enough. If you’re in, I’m in.
Yeah...yeah, you’re right! Thanks, man.

(I should do whatever I can now...
But what?)

For now, the only ones who know anything
besides Jijimon are those guys from before.

We can talk to those things, right? Then why
don’t we crash that little base of theirs?

I’m 100% against that idea! There’s no way we
can talk it out with those creatures!

Jijimon and the others told us all they know,
so they’re our only real lifeline.

You guys feel the same, right? Anyone who
agrees, raise your hand.
(Everyone but Shuuji raised their hand...)

Have... Have you all gone mad?! It’s too
risky! It could even be a trap!
The ayes have it, Shuuji. Ain’t it obvious?

Well yes, but... I... I’m just worried about
everyone...
Are we going, too?

Yeah, that’s the plan. What, you don’t wanna
go?

Sure, it’s dangerous there, but we can’t just
leave you here on your own, either.

Worst case scenario, you could end up being
sacrificed while we’re gone...

Right, it’s dangerous to take them! They’re
just kids, for cryin’ out loud!

(There’s truth in what Shuuji’s saying here.
I’m conflicted...)
(What should I do?)
Agree with Minoru.
Agree with Shuuji.

Let’s take them with us. It’s safer for
everyone to stick together.

That’s right! Okay, now that we’ve decided,
we’d better get ready to go!
...Why? Why can’t any of you understand?

Like Shuuji says, it may be safer for the two
of them to wait here.
But if something happens here...

Exactly! It’s safer to take them with us! If
something happens, we’re around to handle it!
...True. Okay, they’re coming with us.
Urgh...

Why...? I know I’m right. So why can’t any of
you...
Cheer up, Shuuji...
Shut up! Just leave me alone!
Ah...
Hey, you two.
What is it?

I get the feeling...you should keep an eye on
them.
You mean Shuuji and Lopmon?

Yeah. Something’s not right... It’s just
a feeling that I have.

Okay, got it. I’ll try to keep an eye on
them.
Thanks... I appreciate it.
